Posts.EditableText:
This is something I saw TextStories had done, and I thought was such a good idea it is worth making better known. If you are writing your own library files, it is better to give it a .xml extension than a .aslx extension (if you just use other people's it makes no odds).

Quest does not care either either. Where it is useful is you can set a text editor as the default action for .xml files, then when you double-click on your game, it opens up in Quest, and when you double-click your library file, it opens up in the text editor.
